intro: Meranthera, commonly known as the false ironweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the Americas, particularly North and South America. The plants are typically herbaceous, with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. They produce small, clustered flowers that are often purple or pink in color. Meranthera species are often found in moist or wet habitats, such as marshes and stream banks.
